meanings.definition: A line or ridge in an anatomical structure, such as the midline of the brain or spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: The raphae in the brain helps to divide it into two halves.
meanings.sent2: Doctors studied the raphae to understand the structure of the spinal cord.
meanings.sent3: The raphae in the brain decided to take a break and go on vacation.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a strong raphae dividing her thoughts clearly.
meanings.sent5: The raphae in the anatomy book was drawn boldly for easy identification.

meanings.definition: A type of suture used in surgery to close wounds.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon carefully placed the raphae to close the wound.
meanings.sent2: The hospital always stocked up on different sizes of raphae for surgeries.
meanings.sent3: The raphae in the surgery kit decided to have a race with the needles.
meanings.sent4: Her stitches were as neat and precise as a well-done raphae.
meanings.sent5: The raphae gleamed under the bright lights of the operating room.

meanings.definition: A type of painting technique using thin layers of paint to create a smooth surface.
meanings.sent1: The artist applied the raphae technique to achieve a realistic look.
meanings.sent2: Art students practiced the raphae method to perfect their paintings.
meanings.sent3: The raphae in the art class decided to try a new color for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork had a depth that only the raphae technique could achieve.
meanings.sent5: The raphae layers blended seamlessly to create a stunning masterpiece.
